page.title: 07West Wratting : Transport
page.content: There is a bus service following a route which crosses two corners of the area. The service operates three or four buses a day to Cambridge and Haverhill with connections to Newmarket. In addition there are school buses twice a day . One obvious sign of life in the eighties is helicopter flight over the farms. There is traffic to and from Newmarket and the Marshall Airport in Cambridge. A few landowners use planes for crop spraying. Racehorse owners and jockeys fly into the races at Newmarket. The U.S. Air Force (which is based north, at Mildenhall and Lakenheath) fly training craft very low over this part of the country.
